events.name: DevFestDC - Fall Edition - 2017 - Oct 9 @Sheraton Tysons

venue.name: Sheraton Tysons Hotel 8661 Leesburg Pike , Tysons Corner, VA (map)

events.description:
Friends..

We are kicking off our GDG Cloud DC Meetup by partnering with other GDG DC Meetup. An The one Day Event of DevFestDC is on Oct 9 at Sheraton Tysons. The The theme is M3.. Machine Learning, Micro Services, Mobile. There are several Google Cloud speakers are presenting here.

Date: Monday, Oct 9, 2017 at 

Sheraton Tysons 8661 Leesburg Pike, Tysons VA 22182 adjacent to the Spring Hill Silver Line Metrorail stop.

DevFestDC is also supported by GDG Baltimore and GDG Central Virginia (Charlottesville,VA) to make this DevFestDC experience for Developers great.

Please register at www.devfestdc.org (Updates are coming slowly of the sessions/ speakers! Bear with us as always) Use GDGDC17 as promotional code to get 25% Discount.

We will have two tracks of sessions, Firebase Hackathon, Google Assistant Hands-On, Code Labs and more..!

Our KeyNote Speaker will Scott Penberthy - Director, Applied Artificial Intelligence form Google

Thanks,

GDG Cloud DC

events.name: Making microservices micro with Istio Service Mesh & Kubernetes
events.description:
• What we'll do
Date: 02/27/[masked]:30 PM
Location: Google Reston, 1875 Explorer St #1000, Reston, VA 20190

Microservices are here to stay. When applied properly, microservices techniques and culture ultimately help us continuously improve business at a faster pace than traditional architecture. However, microservices architecture itself can be complex to configure. All of a sudden, we are faced with the need for a service discovery server, how do we store service metadata, make decisions on whether to use client side load balancing or server side load balancing, deal with network resiliency, think how do we enforce service policies and audit, trace nested services calls…. The list goes on. In this talk, Ray will introduce Istio, an open source service mesh framework created by Google, IBM, and Lyft. We’ll see how the service mesh work, the technology behind it, and how it addresses aforementioned concerns.

Speaker: Ray Tsang, Developer Advocate, Google
Ray has extensive experience in hands-on and cross-industry enterprise systems integration, delivery and management. He specialized in middleware, Big Data, and PaaS products during his work at Red Hat, while contributing to open source projects, such as Infinispan. In Accenture, managed full-stack application development, DevOps, and ITOps. He created JDeferred, a promise framework for Java and Android developers. He works at Google as a Developer Advocate for the Google Cloud Platform.

• What to bring

• Important to know
events.how_to_find_us: Cloud, Microservices, Istio, Lyft, IBM, Google, Kubernetes

That's right, tickets are slashed across the board by 80% until the sponsor funds run out. That means that there's a limited amount of tickets at this rate, so secure your tickets now before the slush fund runs out.

Please do not RSVP here. Grab your tickets at http://www.devfestdc.org

events.name: Build a Voice User Interface for Google Assistant (Session + Code Lab)
events.description:
Date: Wed, Mar 20, 2019
Location: 1010 Vermont Ave. NW, Suite 700
Washington, DC 20005
Metro: McPherson Square (Orange, Silver, Blue)

Agenda: 6:00 PM Registration + Networking
6:30 - Google Assistant Session
7:15 PM - Code Labs

Session Description: Learn about the latest dynamic in technology -- Voice User Interface (VUI). Learn how Google Assistant works and how you can build for Google Assistant. Bring your laptop to get hands on experience building your first round of conversation!

Speaker Bio: Jessica Dene Earley-Cha is a Developer Advocate for Google Assistant. She loves to connect with developers and explore VUI (voice user interface) to add another dimension to how user interact with technology. Jessica is a full stack developer who enjoys sharing knowledge and support others. You’ll find her either spending time with her dog, collecting strawberry knick knack or coding one of her many personal projects

Space + Snack Sponsored By: GSP ( https://www.gspfa.com/ )

events.name: DevFest DC - 2019 - Fri, June 14th @Capital One - Full Day Event
events.description:
Details
Google Cloud DC, partnering with Google Developers Group Washington D.C. is proud to announce and present the 8th annual DevFest DC. This incredible event is so popular that it will be hosted at not one, but two, Capital One buildings (right next to each other).

Special Discount for Google Cloud DC community members use Code GoogleCloudDC

Note: You must register through Eventbrite to attend

WHAT TO EXPECT:
More than 1,000+ attendees, with industry expert speakers from top tech companies and Developer Experts across industries, tool stacks and hands on code labs.

Find information about the registration, speakers, tickets and other latest news on the conference website www.devfestdc.org

See More: https://www.devfestdc.org

PARKING NOTE:
In an effort to reduce traffic congestion and reduce carbon emissions (similar to Google I/O 2019) DevFestDC has committed to be a “No Parking Event*. This decision has been carefully considered and we are appreciate the support from the community. The "McLean" metro stop along the Silver line is the perfect transportation option for this event. There will be ample volunteers and signage to get attendees to the correct location.

The DevFest DC program team are looking into providing some "free" transportation options (no promises) and will be providing more information as the event approaches.

events.name: 1st GDG Cloud DC Meetup of 2020! - Mobile Edge Explained - The Journey to Cloud
events.description:
Please join us for the First GDG Cloud DC 2020 meetup event!

We have a very special presentation by Cloud experts Mike Keating, Mausam Gautam, and Andy Beck. All three have deep experience building highly scaleable applications across applications that support millions of users.

Overview:
The Edge is the entry point for our mobile applications at Capital One. It's job is to ensure the resilience, security and soundness of the services that drive our mobile experiences. There are a number of underlying technologies and patterns that we have adapted to achieve this end including micro-service architectures and deployments with Netflix tools, the Spring Cloud Framework and Spring Boot. In this Meetup we'll be looking to share some of our learnings and best practices. Our capabilities are largely implemented in Cloud but experience with mobile and other languages is important to our teams.

Agenda:
6:00-6:30p - Meet and Greet. Food will be served, courtesy of Capital One.
6:30p - Mobile Edge Explained - The Journey to Cloud
7:15p - Q & A
8:00p - Wrap-up

Presenters:
Mike Keating (Lead Software Engineer)
Mike leads teams of full-stack developers building web and mobile experiences Capital One's flagship digital servicing application. During his tenure at Capital One, Mike has broken monoliths down into microexperiences, migrated tech stacks from datacenters to AWS, and drank an obscene amount of iced coffee.

Mausam Gautam (Lead Software Engineer)
Mausam is part of highly motivated team who builds fine grained features for mobile applications. Mausam has been involved in the development of many platform level services for our Edge framework and has been developing applications using different programming languages and frameworks for banking and financial industries. He has completed a Machine Learning nano degree recently and is working on various affordable home automation projects using AI and ML.

Andy Beck (Lead Software Engineer)
Andy leads a team of 10 developers building Mobile Edges for Capital One applications. He has been building web, desktop and mobile applications for 20 years using a variety of languages, frameworks and toolsets. He has a Master and Bachelor's degree in Computer Science and is passionate about software engineering.
Mike Keating (Lead Software Engineer)

Location:
Capital One Headquarters (Tysons Corner, VA)
1600 Capital One Dr
McLean, VA 22102

Metro: McLean Station (Silver Line) a short walk away. Take the first floor elevator to the 7th floor and walk around the floor until you see Maplewood Hall on the right hand side. No need to sign in.

Parking:
We highly recommend taking the metro, there isn't much free parking.
